title: Misconceptions about falling objects

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why two objects with different masses will hit the ground at the same time when dropped at the same time?

options.label: A
options.text: The object with greater mass will accelerate faster.

options.label: B
options.text: The force of gravity acting on the object is independent of its mass.

options.label: C
options.text: The object with greater mass will experience a greater gravitational force.

options.label: D
options.text: The acceleration due to gravity is dependent on the object's mass.

options.text: The force of gravity is proportional to the object's mass.

options.label: C
options.text: The force of gravity is independent of the object's mass.

options.label: D
options.text: The force of gravity is directly proportional to the square of the object's mass.
